help.title: Help
help.getHelpWiki: Search for content in the wiki
help.getHelpArchWiki: Search for content in the Arch Wiki
help.aboutBody: Garuda Rani is a system maintenance and diagnostics tool for Garuda Linux. It is designed to help users maintain their system and diagnose issues. It is built using Tauri and Angular.
help.callExorcistBody: You must be pretty desperate to click this button! I set up some special voodoo for you, if you're still having issues with the app, please report them on the Garuda Linux forum or our issue tracker.

diagnostics.title: Debug info
diagnostics.subtitle: Find the information you need to debug your system
diagnostics.failedCmd: Something bad happened and no diagnostics could be retrieved
diagnostics.uploadSuccess: Successfully uploaded to PrivateBin, URL copied to clipboard

welcome.title: Welcome to
welcome.subtitle: The ultimate Linux distro for gaming and multimedia
welcome.maintenanceSub: Keep your system in a good state
welcome.installSub: Get Garuda Linux on your system
welcome.gitlabSub: Have a look at our source code
welcome.chaoticSub: Take a look at package updates and more
welcome.searxngSub: Search engine that respects your privacy

gaming.title: Gaming
gaming.subtitle: Let's get you started with some gaming apps!
gaming.bluez: Generally required for recognizing PS controllers wireless
gaming.xboxdrv: Xbox controller driver, only use if kernel driver doesn't work!
gaming.wineMeta: Meta package for installing WINE and all required dependencies
gaming.bottles: Easily manage wine and proton prefix
gaming.gamehub: Games manager, downloader, library that supports GOG, Steam and Humble Bundle
gaming.heroic: An Open source Launcher for Epic, Amazon and GOG Games
gaming.itch: Installer for the itch.io desktop app
gaming.minigalaxy: A simple GOG client for Linux
gaming.steamNative: Native replacement for the Steam runtime using system libraries
gaming.gamemode: A daemon/lib combo that allows games to request a set of optimisations be temporarily applied to the host OS
gaming.mangohud: A Vulkan overlay layer for monitoring FPS, temperatures, CPU/GPU load and more
gaming.steamtinkerlaunch: Wrapper script for Steam custom launch options
gaming.vkbasalt: A Vulkan post-processing layer. Some of the effects are CAS, FXAA, SMAA, deband
gaming.dxvk: A Vulkan-based compatibility layer for Direct3D 9/10/11 which allows running 3D applications on Linux using Wine
gaming.gamescopeSession: Gamescope session for compositing window management
gaming.gamescopeSessionSteam: Gamescope session optimized for Steam gaming
gaming.boxtron: Compatibility tool to run DOS games on Steam through native Linux DOSBox
gaming.luxtorpeda: Steam Play compatibility tool to run games using native Linux engines
gaming.protonGeCustom: A fancy custom distribution of Valves Proton with various patches
gaming.protontricks: A simple wrapper that does winetricks things for Proton enabled games
gaming.protonupQt: Install and manage Proton-GE and Luxtorpeda for Steam and Wine-GE for Lutris
gaming.winePackage: A compatibility layer for running Windows programs
gaming.wineStaging: A compatibility layer for running Windows programs - Staging branch
gaming.winetricks: Script to install various redistributable runtime libraries in Wine
gaming.antimicrox: Graphical program used to map keyboard buttons & mouse controls to a gamepad
gaming.discord: All-in-one voice and text chat for gamers
gaming.displaycal: Open Source Display Calibration and Characterization powered by Argyll CMS
gaming.droidcam: A tool to turn your phone/tablet into a wireless/usb webcam
gaming.goverlay: A GUI to help manage Vulkan/OpenGL overlays
gaming.gwe: A system utility for controlling NVIDIA GPUs
gaming.gameconqueror: Memory scanner designed to isolate the address of an arbitrary variable in an executing process
gaming.inputRemapper: A tool to change and program the mapping of your input device buttons
gaming.keyboardVisualizer: Turn your OpenRGB-supported RGB setup into a spectacular light show for your music
gaming.mumble: An Open Source, low-latency, high quality voice chat software
gaming.noisetorch: Real-time microphone noise suppression on Linux
gaming.nyrna: Suspend games and applications at any time and resume whenever you wish
gaming.obsStudio: Free, open source software for live streaming and recording
gaming.openrgb: Open source RGB lighting control that doesn't depend on manufacturer software
gaming.oversteer: Graphical application to configure Logitech Wheels
gaming.piper: GTK application to configure gaming mice
gaming.polychromatic: RGB lighting management front-end application for OpenRazer
gaming.scController: User-mode driver, mapper and GTK3 based GUI for Steam Controller, DS4 and similar controllers
gaming.soundwire: Wirelessly transmit any audio from your PC to your Android phone or other PCs
gaming.streamlinkTwitchGui: A multi platform Twitch.tv browser for Streamlink
gaming.vlc: Multi-platform MPEG, VCD/DVD, and DivX player
gaming.xoneDkms: Modern Linux driver for Xbox One and Xbox Series X|S controllers
gaming.xpadneo: Advanced Linux Driver for Xbox One Wireless Gamepad
gaming.dgenSdl: An emulator for Sega Genesis/Mega Drive systems ported to SDL
gaming.dosbox: Emulator with builtin DOS for running DOS Games
gaming.emulationstation: Emulation Station is a flexible emulator front-end supporting keyboardless navigation and custom system themes
gaming.fsUae: An Amiga emulator based on UAE/WinUAE with a focus on emulating games
gaming.hatari: An Atari ST and STE emulator
gaming.kegaFusion: An emulator of classic Sega consoles, including SMS/GG, Genesis/Megadrive and add-ons
gaming.libretroMeta: Meta-package for all supported Libretro emulators
gaming.retroarch: Reference frontend for the libretro API
gaming.mame: Port of the popular Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator using SDL with OpenGL support
gaming.ppsspp: A PSP emulator written in C++
gaming.pegasusFrontend: A cross platform, customizable graphical frontend for launching emulators and managing your game collection
gaming.ryujinx: Experimental Nintendo Switch Emulator written in C#
gaming.sameboy: An accuracy-focused Game Boy/Game Boy Color emulator
gaming.scummvm: A 'virtual machine' for several classic graphical point-and-click adventure games
gaming.snes9x: Portable Super Nintendo Entertainment System (TM) emulator
gaming.waydroid: Python Script to add OpenGapps, Magisk, libhoudini translation library and libndk translation library to waydroid
gaming.mgba: A Nintendo Gameboy Advance Emulator focusing on speed and accuracy

maintenance.title: System
maintenance.subtitle: Keep your system in a good state
maintenance.onlyDirect: This action can not be queued and needs to be run directly.
maintenance.taskRunning: There is already a task running, wait for it to be done first.
maintenance.reinstallPackagesSub: Reinstall all packages on your system
maintenance.btrfsAssistantSub: Manage your BTRFS snapshots and run maintenance tasks
maintenance.updateRemoteFullFixSub: Reset Pacman and reinstall all packages in your OS
maintenance.updateRemoteResetSnapperSub: Remove everything Snapper and recreate its configs
maintenance.resetTooltip: The following files or folders will be reset to their default state:
maintenance.actionFailed: An error occurred while trying to run {{ action }} with error {{ error }}.
maintenance.installationFailedHeader: {{ program }} is not installed and failed to install, cannot proceed. Check the logs for more information

sudo.title: Authentication required
sudo.subtitle: Please enter your password to continue

terminal.title: Terminal
terminal.outputExists: It seems like there is an action running already. Please wait for it to finish before trying to view logs.
terminal.clearCachedData: The output cache has been cleared.
terminal.copyToClipboard: The output has been successfully copied to your clipboard.

systemdServices.error: An error occurred while fetching services, please try again.

evdevLongPressRightClick.description: Evdev long press right click emulation

fish.hint: Setting fish as default shell might cause issues with other programs. It is advised to set it as default via terminal configurations instead.

confirmation.exitApp: Are you sure you want to exit the app?
confirmation.exitAppRunningAction: Are you sure you want to exit the app? There is an action running!
confirmation.resetConfigsBody: Are you sure you want to reset the following configurations?
confirmation.applyOperationsBody: Are you sure that you want to apply all pending operations?

error.sudoPassword: This doesn't seem to be the correct password. Please try again.

systemStatus.updates: This system has pending updates (click for info)
systemStatus.pacFiles: This system has pending .pacnew files, you should check and merge those! (click for info)
systemStatus.aurUpdates: Updating AUR packages is out of scope for this application. Please use an AUR helper like Paru, and review PKGBUILD files before installation.
systemStatus.warnUpdate: Your system not been updated in 2 weeks. Please update your system to ensure security and stability.
systemStatus.learnPacdiff: If you aren't familiar with pacdiff files, inform yourself about them quickly.
systemStatus.openMaintenance: Click the button below to get started.
systemStatus.rebootNowBody: Are you sure you want to reboot now? Make sure to save all your work before proceeding.
systemStatus.warnReboot: It is strongly recommended to reboot your system after applying updates, especially when updating kernels or desktop environments.
systemStatus.snapshotCreation: A Btrfs snapshot will be created before starting the merge.
systemStatus.proceedMerge: Meld will be opened to apply changes. On the left side is the NEW file, on the right side the OLD. Move any useful changes you want to merge from the left to the right side. Click the save button or CTRL + S when done.
systemStatus.cautionMerge: Be aware that putting wrong changes into the OLD file can break your system.
systemStatus.askHelp: If you are unsure close the window without saving and ask for help on the Garuda Linux forum.

operationManager.pendingOperationsRunning: There are operations running, I'm only going to remove the ones already done.
operationManager.thisOperationRunning: Are you out of your mind? This operation is currently running!

kernels.dkmsModulesBrokenTip: Click me to schedule the installation of the broken DKMS modules
kernels.headersMissingTip: Click me to schedule the installation of the missing headers

languagePacks.description: These are the language packs for your installed packages, usually providing translations for the GUI.

settings.title: App
settings.leftButtons: Show window buttons on the left

locales.description: The locales on the right are installed on your system. You can select which ones you want to keep and which ones you want to remove.

taskmanager.scriptMismatch: Script has been tampered with, refusing to execute!
